Authors:
Fatemeh Salmaninezhad, Francesco Aloi, Antonella Pane, Reza
Mostowfizadeh Ghalamfarsa, Santa Olga Cacciola
Title:
Globisporangium coniferarum sp. nov. A new species associated
with conifers and Querqus sp.
Abstract:
Abstract: During a survey of gardens of the Shiraz County,
Iran, aimed at identifying oomycetes associated with roots of ornamental
trees, a Globisporangium sp. not morphologically related to any other
known species in this genus was recovered from conifers and occasionally
from Quercus sp. five isolates of this species were characterized.
Phylogenetic analyses of nuclear (ITS and β-tub) and mitochondrial (cox1
and cox2) loci using Bayesian inference and maximum likelihood analyses,
as well as their distinct morphological characteristics (e.g. abundant
chlamydospores; globose, ellipsoid to ovoid sporangia; amorphous, smooth
oogonia; paragynous to rarely hypogynous antheridia and 1-5 antheridia
per oogonium; and mostly plerotic oospores), cardinal temperatures,
colony morphology on various media, revealed that these isolates belong
to a new species. This paper describes formally Globisporangium
coniferarum sp. nov. as a new species and compares it with other closely
related known Globisporangium species.
